determinism. It is not. Determinism is the result of

that the upper left HD corner contains not only the con¬
scious elements in media, but the individual ones.
The lower right ID comer contains the subliminal and
group characteristics of media. I did not plan it this
way. It just turns out that the subliminal characteris¬
tics are group dynamics. Consciousness will always be
the area of the individual and freedom, but of course
most of those who talk about such things may be merely
subliminally misguided people. Is it not strange that
as we push into the areas of awareness of our own mechan-
isims people should shrill "determinism" when all they
mean is that thev are becoming conscious of their own
t mechanism, that Consciousness can never Itself be mechanical,
herefore the more consciousness the less mechanism. Thus
he whole of the educational enterprise may pass into ESP
hands and the only possible consequence would be libera¬
tion.
If there were some means whereby I could learn
Chinese as completely and unconsciously as the two year
old knows Chinese, would I not be an enormously freer
person in relation to the people and culture of this
planet? Can there be ary cultural or moral value in the
sheer laboriousness of the act of learning? Is not the
possession of that learning the goal? And does this posses-
sion not enable^to associate with people more adequately?
ourselves more adequately? Harry, I assume that
ions of the human spirit are Inexhaustible and also
that they are never to be considered to be In a state of flux.
I would never dream of extending the notion of cultural
relativity to any idea of human relativity.
